org.fujion.highcharts

Class TooltipOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.ancillary.Options
      • org.fujion.highcharts.TooltipOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptionMap.IOptionMapConverter

    public class TooltipOptions
extends Options
    Options for tooltip rendering.

    • Field Detail

      • animation

        public Boolean animation
        Enable or disable animation of the tooltip. In old browsers combined with data-heavy charts, the animation may be slow, so turning it off can be a good idea. Defaults to true.

      • backgroundColor

        public String backgroundColor
        The background color or gradient for the tooltip. Defaults to "rgba(255, 255, 255, .85)".

      • borderColor

        public String borderColor
        The color of the tooltip border. When null, the border takes the color of the corresponding series or point. Defaults to "auto".

      • borderRadius

        public Integer borderRadius
        The radius of the rounded border corners. Defaults to 5.

      • borderWidth

        public Integer borderWidth
        The pixel width of the tooltip border. Defaults to 2.

      • crosshairs

        public Object crosshairs
        Display crosshairs to connect the points with their corresponding axis values. The crosshairs can be defined as a boolean, an array of booleans or an object.
        • Boolean - If the crosshairs option is true, a single crosshair relating to the x axis will be shown.
        • Array of booleans - In an array of booleans, the first value turns on the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. Use [true, true] to show complete crosshairs.
        • Array of objects - In an array of objects, the first value applies to the x axis crosshair and the second value to the y axis crosshair. For each dimension, a width, color, dashStyle and zIndex can be given.
        Defaults to null.

      • dateTimeLabelFormats

        public final DateTimeFormatOptions dateTimeLabelFormats
        For series on a datetime axes, the date format in the tooltip's header will by default be guessed based on the closest data points. This member gives the default string representations used for each unit.

      • enabled

        public Boolean enabled
        Enable or disable the tooltip. Defaults to true.

      • followPointer

        public Boolean followPointer
        Whether the tooltip should follow the mouse as it moves across columns, pie slices and other point types with an extent. By default it behaves this way for scatter, bubble and pie series by override in the plotOptions for those series types. For touch moves to behave the same way, followTouchMove must be true also.

      • followTouchMove

        public Boolean followTouchMove
        Whether the tooltip should follow the finger as it moves on a touch device. The default value of false causes a touch move to scroll the web page, as is default behaviour on touch devices. Setting it to true may cause the user to be trapped inside the chart and unable to scroll away, so it should be used with care. If chart.zoomType is set, it will override followTouchMove Defaults to false.

      • footerFormat

        public String footerFormat
        A string to append to the tooltip format.

      • formatter

        @JavaScript
public String formatter
        Callback function to format the text of the tooltip.

      • headerFormat

        public String headerFormat
        Not sure if this is supported?

      • hideDelay

        public Integer hideDelay
        The number of milliseconds to wait until the tooltip is hidden when mouse out from a point or chart. Defaults to 500.

      • pointFormat

        public String pointFormat
        The HTML of the point's line in the tooltip. Variables are enclosed by curly brackets. Available variables are point.x, point.y, series.name and series.color and other properties on the same form. Furthermore, point.y can be extended by the tooltip.yPrefix and tooltip.ySuffix variables. This can also be overridden for each series, which makes it a good hook for displaying units. Defaults to <span style="color:{point.color}">●</span> {series.name}: <b>{point.y}</b><br/>

      • positioner

        @JavaScript
public String positioner
        A callback function to place the tooltip in a default position.

      • shadow

        public Boolean shadow
        Whether to apply a drop shadow to the tooltip. Defaults to true.

      • shared

        public Boolean shared
        When the tooltip is shared, the entire plot area will capture mouse movement, and tooltip texts for all series will be shown in a single bubble. This is recommended for single series charts and for iPad optimized sites. Defaults to false.

      • snap

        public Integer snap
        Proximity snap for graphs or single points. Does not apply to bars, columns and pie slices. It defaults to 10 for mouse-powered devices and 25 for touch devices. Defaults to 10/25.

      • style

        public final StyleOptions style
        CSS styles for the tooltip. The tooltip can also be styled through the CSS class .highcharts-tooltip. Default value: 
         style: {
     color: '#333333',
     fontSize: '9pt',
     padding: '5px'
 }

      • useHTML

        public Boolean useHTML
        Use HTML to render the contents of the tooltip instead of SVG. Using HTML allows advanced formatting like tables and images in the tooltip. It is also recommended for rtl languages as it works around rtl bugs in early Firefox. Defaults to false.

      • valueDecimals

        public Integer valueDecimals
        How many decimals to show in each series' y value. This is overridable in each series' tooltip options object. The default is to preserve all decimals.

      • valuePrefix

        public String valuePrefix
        A string to prepend to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object. Defaults to "".

      • valueSuffix

        public String valueSuffix
        A string to append to each series' y value. Overridable in each series' tooltip options object. Defaults to "".

    • Constructor Detail

      • TooltipOptions

        public TooltipOptions()
